As a family owned and operated business for over 75 years, we make it our duty to remain honest and forthright in our business and to consistently enrich the lives of others through our service. These core values have been instilled in our company since 1946, when Ed Morse founded Morse Motors with his father. Today, our Chairman and CEO, Teddy Morse, holds fast to these high standards while continuing to build on the family legacy. Our Story Teddy’s grandfather, Ed, served in the U.S. Army Air Corps as a navigator on a B-25 during World War II.  Ed’s bravery and tenacity throughout his service were recognized with several awards of distinction and medals, including the Distinguished Flying Cross, one of the nation’s highest military honors. After the war, Ed began a job as a doorman, procuring rental cars for guests at the Coronado Hotel in Miami Beach. In 1946, Ed and his father started a small 20 car fleet rental company, Morse Motors. When their fleet grew to 2,000 vehicles, they merged with National Car Rental to become Morse-National Car Rental and Ed served as Chief Executive Officer. The Morse family bought into their first dealership in 1961, Cecil Holland Ford in Miami, which soon became Ed Morse Ford. Over the next 50 years, Ed and his son, Ted, added dozens of additional dealerships and realigned their market areas throughout the state of Florida. This keen business sense cemented the Ed Morse prominence as one of the largest family-owned automotive dealer groups in the country. Ed passed away in 2012 at the age of 91, having established himself as a national icon in the automotive industry. Teddy’s father, Ted Morse, served as Owner/Operator, Chairman, and CEO of the Ed Morse Automotive Group and was honored as the recipient of the 2015 Boca Raton Concours d’ Elegance Automotive Lifetime Achievement Award, recognizing the impact that Ted had on the automotive industry. Ted passed away in 2016 at the age of 66 and will long be remembered for his philanthropic work with several local and national charities. Teddy Morse learned the automotive business from the ground up having worked in every department and at every level of dealership operation. With Teddy as General Manager of the Group’s flagship dealership, Ed Morse Bayview Cadillac in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, the dealership earned Cadillac’s Dealer of the Year honor twice. In 2012, Teddy moved to the Morse Operations Corporate Office. As Executive Vice President, Teddy worked closely with his father, Ted, growing the family business while furthering the company’s impact on the local community. Teddy continues the Morse family legacy of charitable work, serving on the board for the Boys & Girls Clubs of Broward County. He is the chairperson for the annual Ed Morse Golf Classic benefitting the Muscular Dystrophy Association and is also actively involved with several military and veterans’ organizations.  Helping to support our nation’s soldiers is a purpose that Teddy holds in the highest regard. Our Excellence The Ed Morse Automotive Group is one of the top mega dealer groups in the nation with numerous award recognitions as proof. Here are just a few of the honors we have earned through our dedication to being the best-of-the-best in the industry: “Dealer of The Year” ~ Automotive News “Quality Dealer” ~ Time Magazine “Cadillac Dealer of the Year” ~ (multiple recipient, multiple years) “Cadillac Certified Elite Service Dealer” ~ (multiple recipient, multiple years) “Honda President’s Award” ~ (multiple recipient, multiple years) “Toyota Chairman’s Council” ~ (multiple years) “Jack Smith Leadership Award” ~ General Motors (multiple years) “National Dealer of the Year” ~ DealerRater “Consumer Satisfaction Award” ~ DealerRater (multiple recipient, multiple years) “Top Rated Dealer” ~ CarGurus (multiple recipient, multiple years) Vital to the inner workings of the day-to-day business is Randy Hoffman, Chief Operating Officer. His keen understanding of best practices for dealership management, which strongly focuses on company efficiency as well as customer satisfaction, is what sets the Ed Morse Automotive Group above and apart from other dealers.  Mr. Hoffman, with the lead of Chairman/CEO, Teddy Morse, work to infuse every facet of the company’s culture with an uncompromising commitment to customer service. Together, they are the driving force that has enabled the company to expand from 12 dealerships to 57 across the U.S. The car business runs deep through the Morse family tree. Richard Danahy, Executive Director of Fixed Operations, and Brian Danahy, Director of Variable Operations - Florida, have implemented a powerful shift in day-to-day processes, which have helped achieve game-changing productivity at every level of our company. Catherine Morse serves as a Corporate Consultant to the Ed Morse e-commerce department, helping build the brand’s online retail presence. Combined, these family members have over 60 years of experience in the automotive industry. A key component of the Ed Morse Automotive Group’s excellence is a core set of values and a strong foundation of over 2,800 employees, we operate award winning dealerships in the states of Florida, Texas, Illinois, Missouri, Iowa, Oklahoma, Colorado and Arizona. We have also established ourselves as one of the premier motorcycle and powersports dealer groups in the country with multiple motorcycle and powersports brands. The Teddy Morse name is becoming synonymous with enjoying the open road as well as experiencing off road adventures. Morse Operations, Inc. is also diversified into a wide range of brands and businesses including Freedom by Ed Morse dealerships, Cowboy Harley-Davidson and Powersports, Teddy Morse’s Harley-Davidson and Powersports, a 240,000 square foot Parts and Distribution Center that has over 60 trucks on the road, a NAPA Auto Parts retail store, several motorcycle clothing and accessory boutiques, and even a hotel. The Ed Morse Automotive Group places a high premium on the accountability of our leaders, managers, and staff-members. From the top down, our organization works to ensure that all our team members’ decisions and actions contribute to the company’s mission of customer service excellence. “You’re Always Backed by Morse” is not just a promise to our customers, it is first a vision. We believe in the value of customer service, and the hallmarks of commitment, integrity, and professionalism are what the Ed Morse brand is built on. When it comes to financing your new Harley-Davidson®, rest assured that you're in capable hands with our dedicated finance team. We're excited about the prospect of assisting you in crafting a financing arrangement that expedites your journey onto the road letting you embrace the great outdoors without delay. But our services go beyond just motorcycle financing - you can also seamlessly include parts and accessories, riding gear, extended service coverage, and all the essentials to ensure your ownership experience is both enjoyable and fulfilling. All of this conveniently bundled into a single, uncomplicated monthly payment! Our adept finance experts are committed to simplifying the motorcycle acquisition process, so there's no need to defer your aspirations. Step in and converse with us today! When you press the starter button on your new Harley-Davidson®, you'll be certain that you've made the perfect decision. Apply Now Don't wait another moment! Take action and apply for a quote today. We order the hotels on this page by how close they are to this attraction. Most of our competitors order these same hotels in other ways that make them more money. How Do We Define Motel? To us, motels are smaller lodgings that have rooms you can enter directly from the parking area. At hotels , on the other hand, you can enter your room only through a hall inside the building. Hotel Booking Tips Beware of non-refundable reservations that could cost you a lot of money if you change or cancel them. + Non-refundable reservations are a gamble that will usually save you less than $10. If you make a $90 non-refundable reservation instead of a $100 refundable booking, you are betting $90 to win $10. Would you do that in Las Vegas? - Don't assume you can cancel a non-refundable reservation without penalty if you notify the hotel weeks or even months in advance. + Often you cannot – because some hotels' profit strategy is to get paid more than once for the same room for the same night. - Always read cancellation policies carefully before you make a reservation. + When is the latest date and time you can cancel without penalty? - More > When you make a reservation, you will receive a confirmation email. Take a copy with you to the hotel. The earlier in the afternoon you check into a hotel, the more likely you will get a room or suite that matches your preferences. < Less Address: 1651 US 1, Ormond Beach, FL 32174 Hotels, Motels, Lodging, and Accommodations near The Pavilion at Destination Daytona - Ormond Beach, Florida FL, USA © 2025 HotelGuides.com, Inc. Thanks to all back on my way wayne spencer, troy, NC Store Location: Daytona Overall 5 Star Overall Rating 3/12/14 I would like to express my sincere gratitude to the staff of the service department at the New Smyrna Beach location.  While enjoying Bike Week 2014, I had the misfortune of experiencing a mechanical breakdown with my 05 Heritage Softail.  While entering an on-ramp to I-95, I accelerated and shifted hard into second gear and was met with an immediate increase in rpms and a loss of forward motion.  All attempts to accelerate above 40 miles per hour resulted in increased rpms and loss of power to the rear wheel.  I managed to limp on back to our campsite and parked the bike for the night.  Deciding the New Smyrna location was more likely to be able to accommodate me, I called at 8:00 a.m. the following morning inquiring whether or not they could get me in and out in one day.  A worn clutch was the suspected culprit.  Service Advisor Greg Fields assured me it would be no problem.  I arrived at approximately 10:00 a.m. via tow truck and off loaded the bike and was immediately attended to by the service department staff.  My phone number was taken and I was advised they would call when they had further information.  I took advantage of the situation by visiting the many vendors on site for Bike Week, as well as activities at HTs Pub 44, adjacent to the dealership.  The problem with the bike was not quite as simple as originally imagined.  The splines on my clutch hub had fatigued and stripped out when I hit second gear allowing the drive shaft to free wheel when the clutch was released.  A number of factors contributed to the failure; one of which I am sure is the fact that I ride the bike daily and was approaching 82,000 miles on the odometer.  During the course of the repair I was kept informed of the progress by my Mechanic, Ben Denosky, Service Advisor, Greg Fields, Assistant Service Manger, Jeremy Sikes, and Service Manager, James Hawtree.  I was back on the road by mid afternoon and free to continue my Bike Week experience.  These gentlemen are a credit to your organization and I am pleased to make that statement.  My only regret is that I dont live close enough to this location to use them on a regular basis.  Once again, thanks for treating me like an old friend.  I look forward to dropping in the next time I am in the area. Dan W Overall 5 Star Overall Rating 10/7/13 I would like management to know that the service department at Destination Daytona, and especially Dennis De Costa, are an excellent group of people to deal with. During your busiest time of year last weekend I noticed my brake light was not working, I checked the bulb and decided to bring it in on Bike week of all weeks. When I approached the service writer it dawned on me that it could be a fuse. I asked the service writer if it would be ok for me to check the fuse and if that was my problem get a new one and be on my way. He allowed me to pull my bike to the side inside the service center write up area and commence taking the bike apart. Once I concluded the fuse was not burned out I noticed the brake relay solenoid. Surely I thought this was the problem, and as I was about to ask if this could be tested when Dennis came up and asked if he could help. I told him the problem and he quickly verified that the solenoid was not the problem and noticed that the brake lever on the handle bar was not properly installed. Ed H Overall 5 Star Overall Rating 10/7/13 Thursday at Bike Week 2013 my 2008 HD Ultra Classic had a problem - a hole developed in my rear brake line from rubbing on the frame. Although no one in FL had the part in stock, Adam was able to work with a Factory Rep on site and get the part by Saturday noon. Adam also noticed a gasket weeping on the inner primary case. During the repair process for the inner primary case gasket, teeth were discovered missing from the clutch cluster and a new one was installed. I was informed the throttle positioning sensor was sending error codes so it was replaced, and the rear wheel rubber bushings were worn and in need of replacing. After picking up the bike everything seemed fine at first. Then I kept experiencing problems with the idle when the engine was warm. It idled between 16 & 20 on the tach consistently. I returned to service and Adam calmly handled the situation but the mechanic, Scott, said everything was within factory specs and no code was being sent. I took the bike again and called Adam to make an appointment the following day for the same problem. Upon arrival I asked Adam to come outside and look at the bike because it was idling at 16 to 18 on the tach. Adam came out and verified I was correct and took the bike in for diagnosis.
